metadata.title: CVE-2017-15265 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Race condition in the ALSA subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.13.8allows local users to cause a denial of service (use-after-free) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted /dev/snd/seq ioctlcalls, related to sound/core/seq/seq_clientmgr.c andsound/core/seq/seq_ports.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-101-generic - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-lowlatency - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-4.4.0-101-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-101-generic - 4.4.0-101.124
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1077.85
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1034-gke - 4.4.0-1034.34
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1034-gke - 4.4.0-1034.34
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-101.124').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.85').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1079.84').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1041.50').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1034.34').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1010.15').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
